intro: Hymenophyllum brevifrons, commonly known as the narrow-fruited haircap, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance and small, ovate leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. The plant forms dense, cushion-like mats and is often found growing on shaded, moist rock surfaces or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Hymenophyllum brevifrons plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
